reviews.text: My wife and I stayed recently at the SLS Hotel South Beach and our experience did not live up to the hype.
reviews.title: OK Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are very small, and the entrance to our room was off a stairwell. The hotel itself is very beautiful, but the overall experience is certainly not worth the high room rate.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I would recommend staying at other South Beach hotels rather than the SLS.
reviews.title: Rippoff, great interior design, overpriced disappointing food.

reviews.text: The overall design of the hotel is quite disappointing. For instance, rather than having the feeling of entering a lovely hotel, it feels rather like entering several different restaurants all with completely different designs as well as an open kitchen with waitstaff walking in and out. There is also an immediate smell of food once entering the hotel along with an open kitchen where the cooking is visible along with a sort of chaotic movement of staff bustling about to serve the restaurants. The design of each space is completely disparate so there is absolutely no cohesion. This includes the design of the small reception area which has no relationship at all to the design of the other areas, which also do not relate to eachother. In addition, there is quite a bit of mirror behind the reception desk...the mirror was not very clean, detracting from any impact the design may have had. It is necessary to walk directly through one of the restaurants to go outside in order to reach the swimming pool area. This isn't as negative during the day as the restaurant isn't quite so full. However, in the evening it isn't ideal as streams of people are walking back and forth while people are dining, along with the staff heading in and out of the kitchen.....the streams of people bang into chairs and it simply isn't peaceful but rather chaotic with activity. Once passing through the restaurant and arriving outside, there is immediately another outdoor restaurant and bar area with yet another completely different design aesthetic.....and to the left yet another restaurant, although inside, with again a completely different design. After passing through all of the differently designed restaurants, the swimming pool is beyond. Almost all of the seating around the swimming pool faces north so not facing in the direction of the sun most of the day. In addition, the seating faces directly into a building with open cabanas....it feels heavy and not lovely to look at. Further, the street to the south of the swimming pool is visible so it not only doesn't feel very private, there is also quite a bit of street noise. Finally, the typical rooms within the hotel are inexcusably small. There might have been an issue with landmark codes which may have made increasing the size of the rooms difficult when renovating the hotel, however a stronger effort should have be made because the rooms are extremely small....even uncomfortable for one person...this includes the bathroom as well. On a positive note, the staff is attentive and welcoming.
reviews.title: Couldn't have had a better experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to enjoy the $ 22 valet parking, make sure to reserve 30 min. waiting time when you want to leave... Great interior design & a nice setting are spoiled by overpriced food. Scallops had to be returned and the rest of the 'surprise' menu was less than impressive. Apart from the hotel's design only the bill was (unpleasantly) impressive. Nice to go there for a drink at the bar.
reviews.title: Perfection in the Heart of South Beach

reviews.text: How do you charge so much money for a "room" without a closet? No closet - no "bedroom." Ordered food - 2 hour wait - really? Shame shame shame. Good thing the "elite" customers can cut the line and pay extra for quality service. I hope I didn't leave with any bed bugs - good thing the bed was nailed to the floor.
reviews.title: Really?

reviews.text: Rooms are small and with NO closets. The hotel is absolutely stunning and definitely is the hottest hotel currently on South Beach. Katsuya is amazing!!! Hyde is really fun and the pool is great. Must see...
reviews.title: SoBe new hot spot!

reviews.text: I really enjoyed SLS South Beach! The service was impressive, especially for a new property and I loved the ambiance. They were able to allow for an early check in after my overnight flight from Los Angeles due to room availability, which was great. I loved Hyde - both the pool and lounge and they offer menu items from Katsuya and Bazaar on the pool menu, which was great. The place was buzzing with a top A-list celebrity. The rooms were modern but a bit small.
reviews.title: SLS South Beach

reviews.text: I've never written a review on a hotel before but after my recent stay @ SLS South Beach I had no choice!!! From the time I stepped thru the doors it was nothing but a terrible and disheartening experience, Jennifer the guest services agent who checked me in authorized my credit card for 2 different transactions with out my permission for room incedentials. Then after I had checked out and was giving back the cash that I had to put back down after my card was already charged I was called back to the hotel and told my card would not go thru so I would have to give the cash back that was giving to me to pay for the room and wait for the authorization hold to drop off my card. The worst experience I have ever had at a hotel period point blank. Be aware the workers here along with manaent are not qualified to handle such and established Beverly Hills name at the south beach location. Oh yeah I was also told by the manager of Hyde Beach when I walked in to get a cup of ice that I couldn't brig my bottle of water and red bull from cvs into the pool area because it wasn't purchased @ the hotel!
reviews.title: Stay Away From This Hotel!

reviews.text: I don't write reviews often; however my stay at SLS Hotel was beyond perfect, I have to share. Upon checking in, we enjoyed the beautiful decor of the hotel and the atmosphere of the lobby.
reviews.title: Long Weekend at SLS - AMAZING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived to our beautiful and spacious room to find a lovely welcome card and a bottle of chilled Champagne to start to celebrations!
reviews.title: Bizarre is the most fantastic dining experience!

reviews.text: The next day we met with the wonderful Andres Gomez, our concierge, whom I had been previously corresponding with in preparation for our arrival. He was able to direct us to a fantastic breakfast cafe, some history on south beach and plans for our day. He helped make our trip great!
reviews.title: Katsuya Birthday Dinner

reviews.text: The Hotel has a hotel pool and a separate livelier Pool Party. We spent an afternoon at the pool party with all the beautiful people enjoying delicious drinks and sushi from Katsuya. Again, the service and atmosphere was great! You must try the frozen pops on a hot day
reviews.title: perfect spot to stay, dine or just hang out

reviews.text: My husband and I have been to South Beach well over 10 times. This hotel is by far the best yet. The location is ideal and service is impeccable. It is a but pricy but that's to be expected in Miami. All of the employees from concierge (namely Leo) to pool staff (BeBe was lovely) are extremely accommodating. We will definitely be staying here upon our next visit to Miami.
reviews.title: Glamorous and relaxing without pretentious employees.

reviews.text: I had a horrible experience. At the time of check in the elevators did not work. The staff was slow to respond to any requests. The elevator service cannot keep up with demand, be prepared to wait twenty minutes or more to get to the upper level rooms. The staff is not trust worthy I had some bad contacts. I will never stay here again and if you do you have been warned.
reviews.title: Slow
